fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let \mathcal {C} be a 2-category. A right lifting in \mathcal {C} is a left lifting in \mathcal {C}^\mathrm {co}.

Given the following diagram in a 2-category, the 2-cell \eta is said to exhibit s as a left lifting of j through t when pasting \eta at s determines a bijection between 2-cells, i.e., for any 1-cell g\colon A\to B, any 2-cell s \Rightarrow g corresponds to a unique 2-cell j \Rightarrow tg.
A 2-category is a bicategory in which the associators and the unitors are the identity 2-morphisms.
